key_title: Key to the species of Pinus

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Conifers
Key to the genera of Pinaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Conifers (Pinophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Conifers (Pinophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves mostly in pairs
Leaves mostly in clusters of 3–5
Leaves less than 10 cm long; winter buds less than 10 mm long
Leaves mostly more than 10 cm long; winter buds mostly more than 10 mm long
Leaves distinctly twisted; cones asymmetrical, sessile, solitary, erect, less than 6 cm long
Leaves not distinctly twisted; cones not or only slightly asymmetrical, stalked, solitary or in clusters, pendulous, mostly more than 6 cm long
Cones mostly more than 10 cm long
Cones less than 10 cm long
Leaves more than 15 cm long; cones often clustered; seeds with a well-developed wing
Leaves less than 15 cm long; cones solitary; seeds with a rudimentory wing (less than 3 mm long)
Cones ovoid-conical, more or less symetrical, yellow-brown; winter bud scales fringed
Cones asymmetrically ovoid, red-brown; winter bud scales not fringed
Leaves mostly in clusters of 3; cones ovoid to cylindrical, often less than 15 cm long
Leaves mostly in clusters of 5; cones narrow cylindrical, more than 15 cm long
Cones asymmetrical, often in clusters
Cones solitary,  more or less symmetrical
Trees to 10 m tall; leaves more than 15 cm long, becoming pendulous; winter buds not resinous
Trees to 30 m tall; leaves mostly less than 15 cm long, spreading; winter buds resinous
Winter buds resinous; cones ovoid; leaves green
Winter buds not resinous; cones narrowly conical or cylindrical; young leaves often glaucous
Cones resinous, more than 15 cm long; scales with a prominent upcurved claw
Cones not resinous, less than 15 cm long; scales with a prominent recurved spine
